title: 13+ Survival Gardening Crops To Grow To Live Off Your Garden

tasks.task: Planting and growing survival crops for a year-round food source
subtasks: Grow sweet potatoes, harvesting their tubers and greens
Propagate and grow yucca (cassava) plants from cuttings
Cultivate yam vines for large tuber harvests
Plant yams in the fence line for easy sourcing
Incorporate banana and plantain trees for fruit and leaves
Grow papayas for fruit and zucchini for abundance in cooler climates
Plant warm-weather squash and pumpkins as a calorie source

tasks.task: Implementing a survival garden with nutrient-dense greens
subtasks: Plant moringa trees for leaves and multivitamin powder
Establish chaya bushes for green superfood and communal sharing
Grow katuk plants as a perennial spinach alternative
Integrate Brazilian or New Zealand spinach for year-round greens
Regularly harvest perennial kale and herbs for flavor and wellness

tasks.task: Integrating nitrogen-fixing and medicinal plants into the garden
subtasks: Propagate pigeon peas for protein and tempeh-making
Sow ground cover beans for nitrogen fixation and protein
Grow turmeric and ginger roots for immunity support
Cultivate elderberry bushes for natural cold remedies

tasks.task: Planting and growing survival crops for a year-round food source.
Implementing a survival garden with nutrient-dense greens.
Integrating nitrogen-fixing and medicinal plants into the garden.
